snippet: All good things come to an end, even for the rich, and sometime this month, Forbes will probably pass out of family control and into the hands of a foreign owner.
abstract: David Carr The Media Equation column notes Forbes will probably pass out of family control and into hands of foreign owner, showing that all good things come to end, even for the rich; says Chinese conglomerate Fosun International, Singapore's Spice Global Investments and Germany's Axel Springer SE are possible suitors, with purchase price for magazine and website of $250 million to upwards of $500 million.
lead_paragraph: All good things come to an end, even for the rich, and sometime this month, Forbes will probably pass out of family control and into the hands of a foreign owner.

headline.print_headline: Foreign Buyers Eyeing Chronicler of the Rich
headline.main: Foreign Buyers Eyeing Forbes Magazine, a Chronicler of the World’s Wealthiest
